GeoTiff Layer_COMMENT: Select the Geotiff layer you want to edit
Extend perpendicularly_COMMENT: If not checked, a single straight line path of interpolation will be applied to the geotiff pixels.

Extension parameters.Blocking Value_COMMENT: This is the value that you can assign to geotiff pixels to stop the perpendicular propagation assignment of values.

Modes_RADIO.Assignment_COMMENT:
This is the normal mode. 
Click on two pixels and the pixels between them will be assigned values that gradually ramp between them. 
The smooth ramping is called interpolation. All modes use interpolated values but do different things with them.
Modes_RADIO.Addition_COMMENT:
Instead of assigning pixel values directly, the interpolated values will be ADDED to the existing pixel values. 
So if you click on pixel with value 0 then 1, halfway way between them has an interpolated value of 0.5. 
So the existing pix at the halfway location will be *0.5
Modes_RADIO.Multiplication_COMMENT:
Instead of assigning pixel values directly, the interpolated values will MULTIPLIED by existing pixel values. 
So if you click on pixel with value 0 then 1, halfway way between them has an interpolated value of 0.5. 
So the existing pix at the halfway location will be +0.5
